summary.para: Note Use D3DX10CompileFromMemory instead of this function.

param.name: pData
param.para: A pointer to effect data; either ASCII HLSL code or a compiled effect.

param.name: pSrcFileName
param.para: The name of the effect file.

param.name: pDefines
param.para: Optional. An array of NULL-terminated macro definitions (see ).

param.name: pInclude
param.para: Optional. A pointer to an ID3D10Include Interface for handling include files. Setting this to NULL will cause a compile error if a shader contains a #include.

param.name: ppCompiledEffect
param.para: The address of a that contains the compiled effect.

param.name: ppErrors
param.para: Optional. A pointer to an that contains compiler error messages, or NULL if there were no errors.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: This function uses the version of the HLSL compiler released in the November 2006 DirectX SDK.
For an example, see Compile an Effect (Direct3D 10).

summary.para: Creates an ID3D10Effect from a buffer containing a compiled effect.

param.name: pData
param.para: A pointer to a compiled effect.

param.name: pEffectPool
param.para: Optional. A pointer to a memory space for effect variables that are shared across effects (see ).

param.name: ppEffect
param.para: A pointer to an which contains the created effect.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: This method is used to create an object from an effect that has been compiled before runtime and loaded into memory. For help precompiling an effect, see Offline Compiling. To load and compile an ASCII .fx file see Compile an Effect (Direct3D 10).
Load the compiled effect at runtime.

summary.para: Create an effect pool (or shared memory location), to enable sharing variables between effects.

param.name: pData
param.para: A pointer to a compiled effect.

param.name: ppEffectPool
param.para: A pointer to the that contains the effect pool.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: A pool is a shared location in memory. Effect variables that are located in a pool can be updated once, and the effect system will take care of updating each effect that uses that variable. To pool an effect variable, tell the effect to locate the variable in a pool when the effect is created, using a helper function such as D3DX10CreateEffectFromFile.
For help compiling an effect, see Compile an Effect (Direct3D 10).

param.name: pDevice
param.para: The device for which the state block will be created.

param.name: pStateBlockMask
param.para: Indicates which parts of the device state will be captured when calling and reapplied when calling . See remarks.

param.name: ppStateBlock
param.para: Address of a pointer to the buffer created (see ).

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: A state block is a collection of device state, and is used for saving and restoring device state. Use a state-block mask to enable subsets of state for saving and restoring.
The structure can be filled manually or by using any of the D3D10StateBlockMaskXXX APIs. A state block mask can also be obtained by calling or .

description.para: In Direct3D 10, a state block object does not contain any valid information about the state of the device until is called. In Direct3D 9, state is saved in a state block object, when it is created.

summary.para: This function -- which disassembles a compiled effect into a text string that contains assembly instructions and register assignments -- has been deprecated. Instead, use D3DDisassemble10Effect.

param.name: pEffect
param.para: A pointer to an , which contains the compiled effect.

param.name: EnableColorCode
param.para: Include HTML tags in the output to color code the result.

param.name: ppDisassembly
param.para: A pointer to an which contains the disassembled shader.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: This returned text includes a header with the version of the HLSL compiler used to generate this object, comments describing the memory layout of the constant buffers used by the shader, input and output signatures, and resource binding points.
Here is an example of disassembling a compiled effect. The example assumes you start with a compiled effect (shown as l_pBlob_Effect which you can see in Compile an Effect (Direct3D 10)).

summary.para: Combine two state-block masks with a bitwise XOR.

param.name: pA
param.para: State block mask on the left side of the bitwise XOR operation. See .

param.name: pB
param.para: State block mask on the right side of the bitwise XOR operation.

param.name: pResult
param.para: The result of the bitwise XOR operation.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Disable all state capturing with a state-block mask.

param.name: pMask
param.para: A mask filled with all zeroes (see ).

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Disable state capturing with a state-block mask.

param.name: StateType
param.para: The type of device state to disable (see ).

param.name: RangeStart
param.para: The lower end of the range of values to set to false.

param.name: RangeLength
param.para: The upper end of the range of values to set to false.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: This is an example of how to call this function. It creates a mask that cannot capture and apply to geometry-shader samplers in slots 2 ~ 23.

summary.para: Enable a state-block mask to capture and apply all state variables.

param.name: pMask
param.para: A mask with everything turned on.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Enable a range of state values in a state block mask.

param.name: StateType
param.para: The type of device state to enable (see .

param.name: RangeStart
param.para: The lower end of the range of values to set to true.

param.name: RangeLength
param.para: The upper end of the range of values to set to true.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

remarks.para: This is an example of how to call this function. It create a mask that can capture and apply to geometry-shader samplers in slots 2 ~ 13.

summary.para: Get an element in a state-block mask; determine if an element is allowed by the mask for capturing and applying.

param.name: StateType
param.para: The type of device state. See .

param.name: Entry
param.para: The entry within the device state. This is only relevant for state types that have more than one entry, such as D3D10_DST_GS_SAMPLERS.

returns.para: Type: BOOL
Returns true if the specified feature is allowed by the mask for capturing and applying, and false otherwise.

summary.para: Combine two state-block masks with a bitwise AND.

param.name: pA
param.para: State block mask on the left side of the bitwise AND operation. See .

param.name: pB
param.para: State block mask on the right side of the bitwise AND operation.

param.name: pResult
param.para: The result of the bitwise AND operation.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.

summary.para: Combine two state-block masks with a bitwise OR.

param.name: pA
param.para: State block mask on the left side of the bitwise OR operation. See .

param.name: pB
param.para: State block mask on the right side of the bitwise OR operation.

param.name: pResult
param.para: The result of the bitwise OR operation.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
This method returns one of the following Direct3D 10 Return Codes.
